intro: Scleria cervina, commonly known as the slender bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its slender, grass-like stems are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered flowers in late summer. Scleria cervina is characterized by its ability to thrive in waterlogged soils and its role in stabilizing aquatic ecosystems.
